item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "If they can get you asking the wrong questions, they don't have to worry about answers." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "The movements which work revolutions in the world are born out of the dreams and visions in a peasant's heart on the hillside." -- James Joyce

item.title: Emily add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "The Captain looked at Fermina Daza and saw on her eyelashes the first glimmer of wintry frost. Then he looked at Florentino Ariza, his invincible power, his intrepid love, and he was overwhelmed by the belated suspicion that it is life, more than death, that has no limits." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Emily add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "People are never so completely and enthusiastically evil as when they act out of religious conviction." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "It all comes down, as it must, to the desires of individual men. Oh, and women too of course, bless their empty little heads." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And this I believe: that the free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world. And this I would fight for: the freedom of the mind to take any direction it wishes, undirected. And this I must fight against: any idea, religion, or government which limits or destroys the individual. This is what I am and what I am about." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Emily add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Paranoids are not paranoid because they're paranoid, but because they keep putting themselves, fucking idiots, deliberately into paranoid situations." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "A screaming comes across the sky." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "She drove like one of the damned on holiday." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Now single up all lines!" -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "She thought how strange it would be if she ever said 'Hello' to him. One did not greet oneself each morning." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Emily add a quote by Truman Capote
item.description: "More tears are shed over answered prayers than unanswered ones." -- Truman Capote

item.title: Emily add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Emily add a quote by J. K. Rowling
item.description: "After all this time?" "Always..." -- J. K. Rowling

item.title: Emily add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "A heart is not judged by how much you love; but by how much you are loved by others" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Love with your mouth shut, help without breaking your ass or publicizing it: keep cool, but care." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Accepting oneself does not preclude an attempt to become better." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Emily add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed. If people all over the world...would do this, it would change the earth." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Emily add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "His soul swooned softly as he heard the snow falling faintly through the universe and faintly falling, like the descent of their last end, upon all the living and the dead." -- James Joyce

item.title: Emily add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Out of that night and day of unconditional wrath, folks would’ve expected to see any city, if it survived, all newly reborn, purified by flame, taken clear beyond greed, real-estate speculating, local politics—instead of which, here was this weeping widow, some one-woman grievance committee in black, who would go on to save up and lovingly record and mercilessly begrudge every goddamn single tear she ever had to cry, and over the years to come would make up for them all by developing into the meanest, cruelest bitch of a city, even among cities not notable for their kindness." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Emily add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "But why think about that when all the golden land's ahead of you and all kinds of unforseen events wait lurking to surprise you and make you glad you're alive to see?" -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Emily add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Emily add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Emily add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver
